context: In addition to the clinical tests, the parents were asked to complete an anamnestic questionnaire. Children with known illnesses or on medication were excluded from the study. The study was authorised by the Ethics Committee of the University of Leipzig. Written informed consent was given by the parents of the children.Exposure monitoring 2.2.1 External exposure Twenty-seven VOC were measured outdoors and indoors (residences and Kindergarten) with main focus on region-specific chloro-organic compounds (tri- and tetrachloroethylene, TRI and TETRA), which are known to be liver toxins. The sample collection with passive sampling monitors (3M, Neuss, Germany) is described elsewhere (Rehwagen et al., 2003). The adsorbed substances were extracted with carbon disulphide and were determined by gas chromatography using an autosystem gas chromatograph (Perkin-Elmer, Berlin, Germany). A PVMS 54 capillary column (length 50m, diameter 0.32mm, thickness 1μm d f) was used for the analysis.
